intro: Ekebergia petitiana var. australia, commonly known as the Australian hakea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, needle-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought resistance through its specialized leaf structure. This variety is often found in heathlands and open woodlands, contributing to local biodiversity.
